main event: A radar-visual sighting of an unidentified flying object occurred at the Fort Meade Missile Master Center in Maryland on February 27, 1961.
interesting points: The object was tracked by ground radar at the Fort Meade Missile Master Center, showing erratic flight behavior with high speed, ability to hover, and rapid changes in direction.
The object was also observed visually, with the witness reporting it as a bright light, larger than a star, with an unusually high speed and ability to stop and change direction abruptly.
The object was tracked at an altitude of approximately 55,000 to 60,000 feet, with a speed of around 900 knots (about 1,035 mph).
No interception or further investigation was carried out, and the report concluded that there was no possible explanation for the occurrence.
The sighting was reported to the Air Force's Aerospace Technical Intelligence Center for further evaluation.
sighted object: a bright light, larger than a star, with erratic flight behavior
witnesses: military personnel at the Fort Meade Missile Master Center
